agentBotApiKey.description: This token should be provided by system admin or obtained via rails console. This token can be used to build bot integrations and can only access limited apis.
agentBotApiKey.name: api_access_token

platformAppApiKey.description: This token can be obtained by the system admin after creating a platformApp. This token should be used to provision agent bots, accounts, users and their roles.
platformAppApiKey.name: api_access_token

userApiKey.description: This token can be obtained by visiting the profile page or via rails console. Provides access to  endpoints based on the user permissions levels. This token can be saved by an external system when user is created via API, to perform activities on behalf of the user.
userApiKey.name: api_access_token

info.description: This is the API documentation for Chatwoot server.
info.title: Chatwoot

get.description: Returns all messages from a specific conversation

parameters.description: ID of the conversation
parameters.name: conversation_id

post.description:
Merge two contacts into a single contact. The base contact remains and receives all
data from the mergee contact. After the merge, the mergee contact is permanently deleted.

This action is irreversible. All conversations, labels, and custom attributes from the
mergee contact will be moved to the base contact.

base_contact_id.description: ID of the contact that will remain after the merge and receive all data

mergee_contact_id.description: ID of the contact that will be merged into the base contact and deleted

400.description: Bad request - invalid contact IDs or contacts cannot be merged

404.description: One or both contacts not found

get.description: List all agent bots available for the current account

post.description: Create an agent bot in the account

delete.description: Delete an AgentBot from the account

404.description: The agent bot does not exist in the account

get.description: Get the details of an agent bot in the account

404.description: The given agent bot ID does not exist in the account

get.description: Get Details of Agents in an Account

post.description: Add a new Agent to Account

parameters.description: The ID of the agent to be deleted.
parameters.name: id

parameters.description: The ID of the agent to be updated.
parameters.name: id

get.description: Get reporting events for a specific conversation. This endpoint returns events such as first response time, resolution time, and other metrics for the conversation, sorted by creation time in ascending order.

schema.description: Array of reporting events for the conversation

post.description: Toggles the priority of conversation

Toggle the status of a conversation. Pass `status` to explicitly set the
conversation state. Use `snoozed` along with `snoozed_until` to snooze a
conversation until a specific time. If `snoozed_until` is omitted, the
conversation is snoozed until the next reply from the contact. Regardless
of the value provided, snoozed conversations always reopen on the next
reply from the contact.

snoozed_until.description: When status is `snoozed`, schedule the reopen time as a Unix timestamp in seconds. If not provided, the conversation is snoozed until the next customer reply. The conversation always reopens when the customer replies.

get.description:
Get the distribution of first response times grouped by channel type.
Returns conversation counts in different time buckets (0-1h, 1-4h, 4-8h, 8-24h, 24h+) for each channel type.

**Note:** This API endpoint is available only in Chatwoot version 4.11.0 and above.
get.summary: Get first response time distribution by channel

parameters.description: The timestamp from where report should start (Unix timestamp).
parameters.name: since

parameters.description: The timestamp from where report should stop (Unix timestamp).
parameters.name: until

get.description:
Get a matrix showing the count of conversations for each inbox-label combination.
Returns a list of inboxes, labels, and a 2D matrix where each cell contains the count of conversations
in a specific inbox that have a specific label applied.

**Note:** This API endpoint is available only in Chatwoot version 4.11.0 and above.

parameters.description: The timestamp from where report should start (Unix timestamp).
parameters.name: since

parameters.description: The timestamp from where report should stop (Unix timestamp).
parameters.name: until

parameters.description: Filter by specific inbox IDs.
parameters.name: inbox_ids

parameters.description: Filter by specific label IDs.
parameters.name: label_ids

get.description:
Get the count of outgoing messages grouped by a specified entity (agent, team, inbox, or label).
When grouped by agent, messages sent by bots (AgentBot, Captain::Assistant) are excluded.

**Note:** This API endpoint is available only in Chatwoot version 4.11.0 and above.

parameters.description: The entity to group outgoing message counts by.
parameters.name: group_by

get.summary: Get outgoing messages count grouped by entity

parameters.description: The timestamp from where report should start (Unix timestamp).
parameters.name: since

parameters.description: The timestamp from where report should stop (Unix timestamp).
parameters.name: until

get.description: Get Account reports summary for a specific type and date range

parameters.description: The Id of specific object in case of agent/inbox/label
parameters.name: id

parameters.description: The timestamp from where report should start.
parameters.name: since

parameters.description: The timestamp from where report should stop.
parameters.name: until

get.description:
Get conversation statistics grouped by agent for a given date range.
Returns metrics for each agent including conversation counts, resolution counts,
average first response time, average resolution time, and average reply time.
get.summary: Get conversation statistics grouped by agent

parameters.description: The timestamp from where report should start (Unix timestamp).
parameters.name: since

parameters.description: The timestamp from where report should stop (Unix timestamp).
parameters.name: until

parameters.description: Whether to calculate metrics using business hours only.
parameters.name: business_hours

get.description:
Get conversation counts grouped by channel type and status for a given date range.
Returns statistics for each channel type including open, resolved, pending, snoozed, and total conversation counts.

**Note:** This API endpoint is available only in Chatwoot version 4.10.0 and above. The date range is limited to a maximum of 6 months.
get.summary: Get conversation statistics grouped by channel type

parameters.description: The timestamp from where report should start (Unix timestamp).
parameters.name: since

parameters.description: The timestamp from where report should stop (Unix timestamp).
parameters.name: until

get.description:
Get conversation statistics grouped by inbox for a given date range.
Returns metrics for each inbox including conversation counts, resolution counts,
average first response time, average resolution time, and average reply time.
get.summary: Get conversation statistics grouped by inbox

parameters.description: The timestamp from where report should start (Unix timestamp).
parameters.name: since

parameters.description: The timestamp from where report should stop (Unix timestamp).
parameters.name: until

parameters.description: Whether to calculate metrics using business hours only.
parameters.name: business_hours

get.description:
